questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

In a 2-node vSAN environment, a storage administrator has setup a vSAN storage policy.
When the stripe width is changed to three, what is the approximate component size of each replica marked in red?

discussion.content:
A is the correct answer. 

100 GB is the size of VMDK, then if you stripe in three different components, each one should have 33,33 GB ~= 33 GB.

A is the correct answer.

100 GB is the size, then if you strip in tree different components, each one should have 33,33 GB ~= 33 GB.

questions.question_text: Which two factors should be considered when planning usable vSAN datastore capacity? (Choose two.)

An ESXi host is being re-purposed from a 4-node cluster. The default policy is in use and storage utilization is low.
Which maintenance mode should be used to avoid storage policy non-compliance?

discussion.content: ensure accessibility will move only that data which is not on any other disks/groups.

D is the correct answer.

Full data migration ensures that storage policy won't become non-compliance.

I agree with the answer D. The host is going to be removed permanently.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.virtualsan.doc/GUID-521EA4BC-E411-47D4-899A-5E0264469866.html

I believe D.
From the same reference "Ensure accessibility â€“ The preferred option for two-host or three-host vSAN clusters using the default storage policy. Ensure accessibility guarantees the enough components of the vSAN object are available for the object to remain available. Though still accessible, vSAN objects on two-host or three-host clusters are no longer policy compliant"

Correct answer is D.
The host is going to remove from the cluster permanently.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.virtualsan.doc/GUID-521EA4BC-E411-47D4-899A-5E0264469866.html

choices.A: One or more hosts in the cluster are unable to ping the vSAN VMkernel adapters of other hosts in the cluster.
choices.C: The vSAN VMkernel adapter is shared with another service such as vMotion.
choices.D: vSAN is configured to use multicast to transmit data.
choices.B: The throughput of the physical network supporting vSAN traffic is less than the recommended minimum throughput.

questions.question_text: What would cause a vSAN: Basic (unicast) connectivity check failure in vSAN Health Check?

discussion.content:
A is correct 

RAID5/6 support up to FTT=2.

A is correct.

RAID5/6 support just FTT=2.
